meanings.definition: Playfully mischievous or humorous in a way that is characteristic of a wag.
meanings.sent1: The wagsome puppy kept stealing socks and hiding them around the house.
meanings.sent2: She had a wagsome sense of humor that always brought smiles to people's faces.
meanings.sent3: The wagsome squirrel decided to play a prank by dropping acorns on the unsuspecting birds below.
meanings.sent4: His wagsome grin was like a ray of sunshine on a cloudy day.
meanings.sent5: The wagsome antics of the children filled the room with laughter and joy.

meanings.definition: Showing a tendency to make jokes or be playful in a lighthearted manner.
meanings.sent1: The wagsome comedian had the audience roaring with laughter throughout the show.
meanings.sent2: She always had a wagsome remark ready to lighten the mood in any situation.
meanings.sent3: The wagsome clown juggled oranges while riding a unicycle, much to the delight of the crowd.
meanings.sent4: His wagsome banter with his friends made every gathering a memorable occasion.
meanings.sent5: The wagsome banter between the siblings made the long car ride feel like a fun adventure.
